Traditional Way

Manual, time-consuming process

1

Limited Trial Awareness

Patients learn about trials through scattered sources—ads, referrals, or chance encounters.

Low awareness & reach
2

Manual Eligibility Screening

Site staff manually reviews patient records and conducts lengthy screening interviews.

34% longer screening time
3

Paper Consent Process

Dense consent documents with complex medical terminology cause confusion and delays.

Confusion & drop-offs
4

Minimal Ongoing Support

Enrolled patients receive limited support between site visits, leading to poor adherence.

High dropout risk
5

Infrequent Check-Ins

Occasional phone calls from coordinators are the primary touchpoint between visits.

Poor retention rates

Key Capabilities

Everything you need to streamline clinical trial patient engagement

Patient Pre-Screening

Match patients to trials and perform eligibility screening with protocol-specific questions.

Consent Guidance

Walk patients through informed consent in plain language, answering questions interactively.

Participant Support

24/7 virtual study concierge for visit reminders, medication prompts, and symptom capture.

Smart Reminders

Automated visit reminders, medication prompts, and follow-up scheduling to reduce no-shows.

Real-Time Data

Capture patient-reported outcomes and symptoms in real time between visits.

Multilingual Support

Engage diverse populations with multi-language support across various platforms.

Integration Benefits
